txt.en: When checked, the character receives Kinship requests.
Click and drag to move the radar
When off, hides your cloak from view.
When on, locked items are shown on the vendor's sell tab.
If checked the skill queue and global reset timer display will be visible.
When performing mounted combat and turn on auto-attack you will constantly move toward your target.
Selection: Only Show Effects Cast By You
When checked, you will see radar blips for all your groupmates' companions.
The UI scale of your inventory bags.
When off, hides your helmet from view.
Are you sure you want to restore the default settings?
When checked, players will have their kinship names displayed
Are you sure you want to log out?
When checked, fellowship vitals displays will hide effects which are nondispellable.
If unchecked, you will automatically decline any sparring offers
When checked, group vitals displays will hide effects which are not cast by you.
Accept tells from friends, groupmates, and tribe members is now [placeholder].
When checked, displays a directional indicator to your current selection.
If checked, you will automatically move to use an item or NPC that's too far away.

If checked, you will automatically accept any automatically bestowed quests except when your quest log is full. When not checked or when your log is full, you will have the temporary ability to manually accept said quests using the Quest Action Button UI.
You will need to restart the game for these changes to take effect.
Decrease the size of all UI elements
Automatically create IM sessions is now [placeholder].
If checked, PCs will appear on your radar
If bar 2 is undocked, toggles the orientation
The UI scale of the toolbar.
When checked, renown / infamy gains will appear over your character's head.
Show Equipped Items Only in Repair UI
When checked, the selected creature or NPC will display a selection indicator.
Toggles the Quest Guide feature which directs you to the general area locations for tracked quest objectives.
When checked, particle and mesh visual effects used to represent monster attacks will be displayed
When checked, all items will display floating names

When checked, your player music will be locked to a time grid. This results in notes being set on beats, each aligned to the closest point on the timing grid and provides a more uniform timing of notes.
If bar 1 is undocked, toggles the orientation
Mounted Combat Default Skills Perform MoveTos
Resets the suppressed Confirmation Dialogs when the button is clicked.
Sets the second button on the left of the toolbar to display selected panel.
Sets the fifth button on the left of the toolbar to display selected panel.
When checked, the assist window will be displayed.
If checked, your current location coordinates will be displayed below the radar
When checked, particle and mesh visual effects used to represent avatar attacks will be displayed.
You cannot set advanced graphics settings until you download the full game.
The size of Attunement Panel to display.
Click to create a new binding for this action.
Sets the fourth button on the left of the toolbar to display selected panel.
When checked, floating damage will appear based on the checkboxes below.
Click to clear all bindings for this action.
Sets the seventh button on the left of the toolbar to display selected panel.
When checked, players will have their tribe names displayed
When checked, the character receives trade requests.
When checked, floating damage numbers appear over creatures other than the PC and things he or she affects.
Sets the fifth button on the right of the toolbar to display selected panel.
When checked, the selection indicator will only be shown when you're in combat. This preference is only available when the \qSelection Indicator\q preference is ON.
Many elements of the UI can be customized. Press CTRL-\ to toggle the UI lock, so you can reposition panels to wherever you like. Press CTRL-\ again to re-lock your UI.
Show ranged weapon when out of combat
The UI scale of the your group's or first raid group's vitals.
If checked, monsters will appear on your radar
When checked, you will be unable to see cosmetic pets summoned by other players.
Suppressed Confirmation Dialogs have been reset.
Display combat state break notices in chat window
See Icons for All Paper Doll Slots
If checked, the quest tracker will show party status instead of objectives.
Toggles the visibility of the event quickslots UI.
The UI scale of the third raid group's vitals.
Show Trivial Quest Icons In Radar
Use dynamic shadow maps in outdoor environments.  DirectX 10 Graphics must be enabled.
The UI scale of the fourth raid group's vitals.
When checked, Opponent Vitals will hide effects which are nondispellable.
When checked, an induction progress bar will be shown above any character or pet pending an action. This preference is only available when the \qFloating Names\q preference is ON.
Toggles the audio/visual feedback that occurs with each completed store order
When checked, you will see a special reticule around your target's target, as well as the vital information for that target.
Enabling this will show the Quest Guide indicators on the map that will show you possible quest objective locations.
When on, only equipped items are shown in the repair window.
If unchecked, you will automatically decline any fellowship offers
When checked, landscape music plays uninterrupted by combat music.
When checked, player music will be more responsive, but it may be more difficult to sync music with other players.
If checked, quest tracker will be automatically filled
The currently selected user created skin to be applied over the default UI.
If unchecked, you will automatically decline any kinship offers
If checked, the Post Page will set your Auction Item's Initial Price and Buyout Price to match those of the most recently posted identical item.
When checked the Raid Micro Vitals will show companion vitals.
When checked, displays (non-quest related) icons over the heads of vendors, trainers, and other NPCs.
When checked, displays quest icons over the heads of quest related NPCs.
When checked, you will see radar blips for all your fellows' companions.
If checked, you will see world tooltips instantly
When checked, text spoken in the 'Say' chat channel will show a chat bubble for players within visual range.
When checked the full-screen effects associated with Dread will be displayed.
If checked, your personal house will be labelled with your name.
The UI scale of Traits, Skills, and Quest Log panels.
When checked this turns on optional, client-only combat animations.  This has no impact on combat effectiveness or gameplay, it is only a cosmetic option.
Do you wish to keep the new setting?  ([placeholder])
The UI scale of your soldier vitals.
If enabled, bar 4 will appear in the bank of shortcut bars in the middle of the toolbar
When checked, incoming chat will be filtered and profanity replaced with inoffensive text.
The UI scale of the radar.
Choose the border animation style for activated quickslots.  Default animations are highly visible, while Simple uses bygone basic animations.
When checked, my fellows display floating names.
When checked, group vitals displays will hide effects which are nondispellable.
If bar 4 is undocked, toggles the orientation
Click and drag to move this pinned tooltip
If enabled, bar 5 is always shown
When checked your surname will be displayed as part of your active title.
The UI scale of Deeds panel.
Adjusts the maximum distance at which floating damage numbers appear.
When checked, skills that are flagged to enable auto-attack will do so.

The next key you press or mouse button that you click will be mapped to the '[placeholder]' action.  You may combine keys with SHIFT or CTRL to create new mappings.  Remapping joystick input or mouse buttons zero(0) or one(1) is not supported.\n\nPress the ESC key to cancel.
When checked, Opponent Vitals will hide effects which are not cast by you.
If checked, newly discovered deeds will automatically be added to the quest tracker
When checked, all players display a floating name.
Changing the slider value will change the opacity of the chat window background.
When off, hides your gloves from view.
If checked, you will only get tells from players in your friends list, fellowship, raid and kinship. You will also receive tells from players you have sent a tell to.

When checked combat attacker animations that overlap will blend, smoothing out the transition between skill plays.  When disabled only one combat animation will be allowed per attacker causing an instant transition from one animation to the next as skills are executed.  This has no impact on combat effectiveness or gameplay, it is only a cosmetic option.
Improves lighting detail for distant landscape.  DirectX 10 Graphics must be enabled.
When enabled, some persistent area effects (hotspots) will show supplemental graphics outlining their borders.
When checked, bloody particles and mesh visual effects will be displayed as part of attack and hit effects.
If checked, the client will be voice enabled.  This allows the client to hear other voice enabled players as well as participate if they wish.
Must Restart So Changes Can Take Effect.
Sets the third button on the left of the toolbar to display selected panel.
If checked, tooltips appear in a fixed location.  If not checked, tooltips will appear near your mouse
If checked, items will appear on your radar
Locking the toolbars prevents you from dragging and dropping items on them.
Each entry adjusts the way the vital bar displays text information.
Automatically add tasks to quest tracker
When checked, other players' floating damage is displayed.
When checked, pets of other players will display their names floating above their heads.
When checked, reputation changes will appear over your character's head.
When checked, barter item gains will appear over your character's head.
Sets the sixth button on the left of the toolbar to display selected panel.
If enabled, bar 2 will appear in the bank of shortcut bars in the middle of the toolbar
When off, hides your class slot from view.
The UI scale of your companion's quickslot bar.
repeated key presses in chat will automatically delete and close the chat console.
Sets the second button on the right of the toolbar to display selected panel.
If checked, Destiny Wallet will be visible
Sets the third button on the right of the toolbar to display selected panel.
Toggles the visibility of the Allegiance progress display UI.
If checked, portals will appear on your radar
If bar 5 is undocked, toggles the orientation
The UI scale of Barber Shop panel.
When checked, while shapeshifted, bar 1 and the main quickslot bar swap places.
If the bar 3 is undocked, toggles the orientation
When checked, the character receives Sparring requests.
The UI scale of your vitals.
When checked, every companion action will display a message in the chat window.
Enable NPC colour Text Voiceover Sounds
If checked, milestones will appear on your radar
When checked, all NPCs will display floating names.
The UI scale of your quickslot bars.
If checked, the timestamp of each message will be displayed.
The UI scale of the your fellowship's or first raid group's vitals.
When off, hides the pvmp rank icon from the nameplate ui.

When enabled you will see notification of who ended some combat states such as rooted, dazed or feared by attacking or damaging the target.  These notices are displayed in the 'Combat Event' chat filter.
When enabled, releasing the movement key will automatically decrease the speed of your war-steed.
Turns on/off floaty damage over your selected target's portrait.
Close the Options Panel (keyboard shortcut: F3).
The UI scale of options panel.
Display Companion Orders In Chat Window
Accept tells from friends, fellows and kinship members is now [placeholder].
The UI scale of your escort vitals.
Shows tooltips for equipped items in the same inventory slot
When checked you will attempt to execute your skills on your target's target if the original target is not valid.
If checked, you can configure your microphone for voice chat. Adjust the microphone gain and capture threshold until the metre appears green while you speak.
When checked, your pets will display their names floating above their heads.
Show Companion Vitals in Raid Vital Windows:
If checked, you will automatically try to take the contents of any corpse or container that you open as if you had pressed the 'Loot All' button.
Name, Background, or None set where the class colour visualization will occur in the Raid Micro Vitals.
Send tells to IM is now [placeholder].
Show Selection Indicator in combat only
When checked, floating damage numbers appear over creatures in the game.
When checked your rank will be displayed as part of your active title.
The UI scale of Character panel.
If enabled, bar 1 is always shown
If checked, a special effect will be played whenever a responsive skill is available for use.
If enabled, bar 5 will appear in the bank of shortcut bars in the middle of the toolbar
If checked, new items arriving in your inventory bag will be highlighted.
Send Tells to IM Chat Tab
This will globally increase or decrease the size of the UI elements.
If checked, NPCs with colour Text will also play an associated Voiceover sound.
If unchecked, you will automatically decline any group offers
Show off-hand weapon when out of combat
The UI scale for class-specific ability bars (e.g.- attunement and gambit bars)
When checked, fellowship vitals displays will hide effects which are not cast by you.
[placeholder] is already bound to another action. Do you wish to overwrite it?
You will leave Session Play in [placeholder] seconds...
When enabled, incoming adoption requests will be displayed.
When checked, my character displays a floating name.
Click and drag to move options window
When checked, floating names will appear based on the checkboxes below.
If enabled, bar 3 is always shown
When off, hides your shoulder equipment from view.
The UI scale of your quest tracker.

The client must be restarted for very high texture detail to be enabled.  There is an available update to the high resolution texture data which has not been applied to this client.  Please close your client with very high detail enabled and restart to begin patching.
If you press a skill button or the auto-attack enable button without a selection while this option is enabled, you will target the nearest enemy instead of executing the skill.
When on, only trainable skills are shown in the skill trainer window.
Are you sure you want to quit?

Some skills support miss chance penalties if used while moving as an alternative to the requirement to be stationary to execute the skill.  When this option is checked you accept these penalties instead of being rooted in place while executing such skills.
If unchecked, you will not see the loot messages when given items during a secure trade.
Resets the Tutorial Hints when the button is clicked.
The UI scale of your mount displays.
Show Floaty Damage On Selection Portrait
The UI scale of your companion's vitals.
If checked, tasks will automatically be added to the quest tracker
Sets the first button on the left of the toolbar to display selected panel.
Group: Only Show Effects Cast By You
When a Tell is received and 'Send Tells to IM Chat Tab' is enabled, this preference automatically creates an IM session from the teller.
Sets the eighth button on the right of the toolbar to display selected panel.
If enabled, bar 2 is always shown
Sets the first button on the right of the toolbar to display selected panel.
Allow skill buttons to target nearest enemy
Sets the sixth button on the right of the toolbar to display selected panel.
When checked, the selection will show a floating vital bar.
When off, hides your boots from view.
Sets the seventh button on the right of the toolbar to display selected panel.
If checked, you will only get tells from players in your friends list, group, raid, and tribe. You will also receive tells from players you have sent a tell to.
When checked, particle and mesh visual effects used to represent weapon damage types will be displayed
Sets the fourth button on the right of the toolbar to display selected panel.
Show the vitals of your selection's target
If checked, NPCs will appear on your radar
Toggles the visibility of the landscape soldier vitals UI.
Provides assistance with moving while in combat, turning to or following your selection based on the skills you execute.
The UI scale of your opponent's vitals.
You will be logged out in [placeholder] seconds...
If checked, quest tracker will be visible
The UI scale of the second raid group's vitals.
If unchecked, you will automatically decline trade requests
If checked, Debuff icons display in a separate row from Buff icons.
When you execute a mounted combat skill you will perform a moveto to the target.
Show main-hand weapon when out of combat
Enable skill miss chance penalties while moving
Displays the numbers on the shortcut UI
Increase the size of all UI elements
If enabled, bar 3 will appear in the bank of shortcut bars in the middle of the toolbar
When checked, displays a numerical value overlay on all vital bars.
When checked, players will have their titles appended to their names.
When checked, experience gains will appear over your character's head.
The UI scale of the Allegiance progress tracker.
If enabled, bar 4 is always shown
If enabled, bar 1 will appear in the bank of shortcut bars in the middle of the toolbar
Fellowship: Only Show Effects Cast By You
When checked, tells will be routed to the chat window's Instant Message tab.
When checked, the selected creature or NPC will display a floating name.  This preference is only available when the \qToggle Floating Names\q preference is OFF.
Automatically add deeds to quest tracker
When enabled, you will execute emotes when nearby players target you with emote inducing skills.
When checked, my groupmates display floating names.
When checked, the character receives Fellowship requests.
Toggles the visibility of the event tracker UI.
When checked, icons for items are overlaid with numbers when made into shortcuts.
Enabling this will show the Quest Guide indicators on the radar that direct you to quest objectives.
If checked, you will see icons for quests that are significantly below your current level in the radar. If checked, \qTrack Nearby Quests\q will add these quests to your quest tracker.
If checked, the map will update to show the location of the mouse cursor
When checked, destiny gains will appear over your character's head.
Click the action name to add a new binding.
When checked, your floating damage is displayed.
When checked, LOTRO will trigger light changes on Alienware PCs/peripherals if Alienware LightFX is installed.
If unchecked, you will automatically decline any tribe offers
If checked, you will automatically target enemies that attack you
When checked, particle and mesh visual effects used to represent hits in combat will be displayed.
